sect1.title: Overview of the Window

textobject.para: A display of the &argouml; window, showing at the top the menu bar, in the main area four sub-windows and at the bottom a status bar. The four sub-windows are arranged two by two, and named, clockwise from top left as: Navigator Pane, Editing Pane, Details Pane and To-Do Pane. At the top of the diagram Pane is a horizontal toolbar.

sect1.para: At the top of screen is a menu bar described in . The bulk of the window comprises four sub-windows or Panes. Clockwise from top left these are the Navigator Pane (see ), Editing Pane (see ), Details Pane (see ) and To-Do Pane (see ). At the top of the details Pane is a toolbar. An overview of the Panes is given in . Finally at the bottom of the window is a status bar described in .

sect1.title: General Information About Panes
sect1.para: The four sub-windows of the main &argouml; window are called Panes. Clockwise from top left these are the Navigator Pane (see ), Editing Pane (see ), Details Pane (see ) and To-Do Pane (see ). At the top the details Pane is a toolbar.

sect2.title: Resizing Panes
sect2.para: You can resize panes by dragging on the divider bars between them.

sect2.title: Looking at Different Diagrams Simultaneously
sect2.para: You can spawn the Editing Pane by double-clicking on the As Diagram tab. It will then show as an individual window and you can put it next to another.
The same effect is achievable with the tabs of the Details Pane.

note.para: There is no equivalent function for the Navigation or ToDo Panes.

sect2.title: Reducing the Number of Panes Open
sect2.para: This function is not implemented directly. However you can spawn a pane (see ) and maximise this to be the whole window, which achieves the same thing.
